title: Satellite operators make case for helping military track ground targets
summary: The U.S. Air Force and Space Force are exploring the development of a dedicated GMTI satellite constellation while considering the integration of commercial remote sensing satellites for ground target tracking. Industry executives, including representatives from Umbra, Maxar Intelligence, and Iceye U.S., discussed the potential and limitations of commercial systems for military applications during the Satellite 2024 conference.
why_it_matters: The discussion highlights the potential for collaboration between military and commercial satellite operators to enhance ground moving target indication capabilities, potentially reducing costs and improving situational awareness. However, commercial systems currently lack the persistent custody capabilities required for tracking fast-moving targets.
